Dedicated to all combatants of WWII: Lest we forget - we are all first and foremost humans.

Lest we forget: Start of World War II

  • By Artem V. Shamsutdinov
  • September 1st, 2025

Today is the 86th anniversary of the start of World War II.

Resistance to western imperialism in East Asia, combined with economic hardship, nationalism and militarism in the Japanese Empire culminated in 1905 Russo-Japanese War, which combined with the WWI losses in the Russian Empire contributed to its fall in 1917. In 1910 the Japanese Empire formally annexed Korea. In September 1931 in the midst of the first phase of the Chinese Civil war (1927-1936) the Imperial Japan invaded Manchuria. The Second Sino-Japanese War started in July of 1937. In September of 1940 Imperial Japan invaded French Indochina.

The European roots of WWII are known to lie in the harsh terms of the Treaty of Versailles in 1919 after the end of World War I (1914-1918), in which the British-French(-Russian Triple) Entente 1904(07) defeated (with Russia withdrawing in 1918 due to devastating losses) the Triple Alliance (1882) of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy. After fierce street battles between the members of the right (including the NDA) and left (including KPD) movements during the Political Violence period and the severe impacts of the Great Depression, the Nazi Party took control of Germany in 1933. Driven by Nazism Germany annexed Austria in March 1938, Sudetenland in October 1938 and Bohemia and Moravia in March 1939.

The Axis Powers of WWII began forming with the Rome-Berlin Axis of Fascist Italy and Nazi Germany in October 1936. It was followed by their Pact of Steel in May 1939. In June 1940 Fascist Italy allied with Nazi Germany against France and the British Empire. Signing of the Tripartite Pact in September 1940 marked the Entry of Japan in the Axis.

The Spanish Civil War was fought from July 1936 to April 1939 between the Nationalists of Spanish State, supported by the Axis, and Republicans of the Second Spanish Republic supported by the Soviet Union and Mexico.

On September 1st, 1939 the Nazi Germany invaded Poland. On September 3rd the British Empire declared war on Nazi Germany. The preceding signing of Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact on August 23rd, 1939 divided Eastern Europe without a direct confrontation between the Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union. On September 17th, 1939 the Soviet Union invaded Poland, immediately following a cease-fire with Imperial Japan. France was attacked and defeated by the Axis in May-June of 1940. The air and naval battle of Britain from July to October 1940 overlapped with the bombings of the Blitz from September 1040 to May 1941.

The African campaigns started in June 1940 in Italian Libya. In September 1940 the Kingdom of Egypt was attacked by Fascist Italy, with Nazi Germany joining in February 1941. In November 1942 Allies invaded Vichy-French controlled North Africa in modern-day Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. In June 1940 Fascist Italy attacked the British colonies and protectorate surrounding the Italian East Africa. Allied main counter counterattack was initiated in January 1941. Fighting in East Africa took place in modern day Ethiopia, Eritrea, Somalia, Djibouti, Kenya, and Sudan. In May 1942 Allies invaded Vichy French-controlled Madagascar.

The Greco-Italian War took place between October 1940 and April 1941, culminating in the Battle of Greece in April - June 1941. In April 1941 Axis invaded Yugoslavia. The Anglo-Iraqi war took place in April-May 1941. The Syrian-Lebanese campaign took place in July 1941. In August 1941 Allies invaded Iran.

In June 1941 the Nazi Germany attacked the Soviet Union and in December 1941 Imperial Japan attacked the United States.

Immediately following the Attack on Pearl Harbor in December 1941 Imperial Japan invaded Thailand, started the invasion of the Philippines, Hong Kong, and began invading British, USA, Australian and independent pacific islands. Brunei was also invaded in December 1941. Between December 1941 and February 1942 Imperial Japan conquered British territories of modern day Malasiya fighting against Indian and other troops of the British Empire.

In January 1942 Imperial Japan started the invasion of the Dutch East Indies - modern day Indonesia. In January 1942 it attacked Burma, defended by Indian, Chinese and African troops. Also in January 1942 it attacked New Guinea and in July 1942 the Territory of Papua. British Singapore Surrendered to Imperial Japan in February 1942. In February 1942 Imperial Japan started air raids on Australia. Also in February it occupied Portuguese Timor. In March 1942 Imperial Japan started the Indian Ocean raid and occupied Andaman and Nicobar Islands. In 1944 it attempted to occupy Manipur.

The complex pre-history of WWII lead to the deadliest war in human history, with an unknown total number of wounded. It must never be repeated - Lest We Forget.
